alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 2:24AM EDT until August 28 at 8:30AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Carroll County in southwestern Virginia... Southwestern Patrick County in southwestern Virginia... * Until 830 AM EDT Monday. * At 224 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen since midnight. The expected rainfall rate is 3 to 5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible through 5AM in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hillsville... Fancy Gap... Cana... Ararat... Gladesboro... Dugspur... Laurel Fork... This includes the following streams and drainages... Burks Fork, Birds Branch, Ararat River, Big Reed Island Creek, Brushy Fork and Brannon Branch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...3-5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
